DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: FALCO FILHO, J. B. P.;PFALCAOFILHO, J;Falco Filho, Joo Batista P.;FALCO FILHO, J.B.P.;FILHO, J. B. P. F.;FILHO, J B P FALCAO;FALC, JO;FALCAO, JO;FALCO FILHO, JOO BATISTA PESSOA;FILHO, JOO BATISTA PESSOA FALCO;FILHO, J B P FALCO

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: possui graduao em Engenharia Mecnica Aeronutica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1981), mestrado em Engenharia Aeronutica e Mecnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1996) e doutorado em Engenharia Aeronutica e Mecnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2006). Atualmente aposentado do servio pblico federal, tendo atuado por 35 anos no setor de pesquisa aeronutica na EMBRAER e IAE (DCTA). Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia Mecnica Aeronutica, com nfase em Mecnica dos Fluidos, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: modelo matemtico, tnel de vento transnico, mistura de jato, ensaios de modelos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Engenharia Mecnica Aeronutica from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1981), master's at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1996) and ph.d. at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2006). Now is retired from the Federal Public Service in Brazil, after 35 years acting in Aeronautic Research in EMBRAER and IAE (DCTA). Has experience in Mechanical Engineering, focusing on Mechanic of Fluids, acting on the following subjects: modelo matemtico, tnel transnico, tnel de vento transnico, rudo ambiental and parmetros concentrados.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: OBS: Os dados abaixo foram importados do Sistema CNCT.&#10;&#10;EXPERINCIA PROFISSIONAL&#10;&#10;&#10;&#10;CIENTFICA&#10;Desenvolveu programa em computador para anlise transiente do circuito aerodinmico do tnel transnico com seus diversos sistemas de controle acoplados, consistindo do trabalho de tese de Mestrado desenvolvido.&#10;&#10;TCNICA&#10;Atua nas reas de controle e qualidade do ar do complexo de tneis de vento transnico e supersnico, consistindo a participao na anlise, especificao e projeto de componentes e parmetros de operao dos sistemas mecnicos do complexo.&#10;&#10;Participou do projeto conceptual do tnel transnico 2,0x2,4m desenvolvido na sede da firma norte-americana SVERDRUP Tech. Inc., Tennessee, de novembro de 1988 a junho de 1989, acompanhando o projeto nas reas relacionadas com o projeto da Cmara Plena, concepo dos sistemas de compressores, secadores, hidrulicos e pneumticos do tnel.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Anlise Numrica/Experimental do Veculo de Sondagem Sonda III com Detalhe da Interferncia Empena/Fuselagem para nmero de Mach 1,3
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O projeto desenvolve as caractersticas supersnicas do Tnel Transnico Piloto do IAE, atravs do projeto e da instalao de uma primeira garganta supersnica para nmero de Mach 1,3, para serem realizados ensaios com o veculo de sondagem Sonda III do IAE. Nestes ensaios so investigados os efeitos de interferncia entre as aletas e a fuselagem. So desenvolvidos modelos especficos numa escala adequada e dispositivos de acionamento das empenas. Simulaes numricas so elaboradas com fins de comparao com os resultados no tnel.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The project develops the supersonic characteristics of the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel of IAE by means of designing a first throat for the tunnel for Mach number 1.3 and the whole process until the final tests. The tunnel will be used to undertake experiments with the sounding rocket Sonda III of IAE. In these tests the interference between the fins and the fuselage will be specially addressed. A specific model of the Sonda III with adequate scale factor will be developed with fin rotation device. Numerical simulation will be also developed for each test configuration with the purpose of comparison with experimental data.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Numerical/Experimental Analysis of Sounding Rocket Vehicle Sonda III with Fins/Fuselage Interference Details

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho descreve um modelo matemtico baseado na tcnica de parmetros concentrados e sua aplicao no circuito aerodinmico de um tnel de vento transnico, para anlise do comportamento transiente, incluindo aes de controle para o tnel. Ele foi desenvolvido com um enfoque abrangente para permitir adaptaes a novas solues, principalmente para tneis de circuito fechado, uso contnuo por compressor, associado ao uso intermitente de injeo, com controles independentes de presso, temperatura e nmero de Mach relativos s condies na seo de testes.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: apresentada justificativa para a utilizao do Sistema de Extrao Forada em tneis de vento transnicos, relacionando os principais parmetros para a definio deste sistema, sendo dada especial ateno ao parmetro umidade presente no escoamento sob aspectos tcnicos e de custos e analisadas as principais implicaes em tneis pressurizados, nos quais a presena de vazamentos pelas paredes estruturais do tnel, causados pela diferena de presso, requer um sistema de secagem do ar. Para isto foi desenvolvida rotina numrica em diferenas finitas para clculo da evoluo da umidade na seo de testes durante um ensaio.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: It is presented the reasoning for using the Forced Extraction System in Tansonic Wind Tunnels, by the main parameters involved in its design conception. A special attention is&#10;given to the flow humidity either by technical aspects as well as the cost involved. It is also considered the pressurization of the tunnel circuit that causes leakage through the structured walls, when differences in pressure occur, and so a drier system is required. A numerical model was developed in finite differences to calculate the humidity evolution in the test section during a tunnel run.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The process of injection, as applied to a wind tunnel, is considered. The dissipative effects in the mixing region can be classified as &quot;internal&quot;, due to the shear layer between the two jets, as well as &quot;external&quot;, due to the friction on the walls and, eventually, the drag of immersed bodies. The aim of this work is to use optimization techniques to analyse the injection process taking into account all possible kinds of dissipative effects.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Study of the Mach Number Uniformity Over a Horizontal Plane Inside the Test Section of a Wind Tunnel

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Ana Cristina Batista de Jesus Avelar

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (PTT) located at the Aeronautics and Space Institute (IAE), one of the institutes that embody the Aerospace Technology General-Command in So Jos dos Campos - Brazil, is a reduced-scale version of an industrial transonic wind tunnel project. It is a closed loop tunnel with a 0.25 x 0.30 x 0.81 m slotted test section, powered by an axial compressor and an injection system that enable the tunnel to reach Mach number from 0.2 to 1.3 in a continuous operation. An important task in the calibration routine of a transonic wind tunnel is to guarantee that the Mach number is relatively constant in the test section for as much as the trial endures. This kind of assurance gives a greater reliability to the results obtained in subsequent tests in the same tunnel. In this sense, measurements of the Mach number distributions over a horizontal plane inside the test section were made to estimate the variation of this parameter over the test section during an experiment. The chosen form to make this estimation is to plot the surface of the Mach number versus the position of the measurement, following with the calculation of the standard deviation. In this paper an analysis of the results obtained and a description of experiments will be presented. In the performed experiments the tunnel circuit was used in a closed circuit operating only by induction with the injection system. The stagnation pressure in the injection nozzles were adjusted to 4 and 6 bar. This configuration only reached Mach number of 0.3 and 0.4, respectively. So the operation occurred in an intermittent way with average time of 80 seconds by trial. Mach number was calculated by the measurement of the total and static pressure in different points of the horizontal plane with a Pitot probe. Since the test section is involved by a plenum chamber, a remote-positioning system had to be developed to make several measurements in a single trial possible. This system is basically constituted

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Euler Equations Applied to Flow Over NACA 0012

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao Pblica, Defesa e Seguridade Social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A fast, accurate numerical code based on implicit resolution of the Euler Equations was used to determine the main flow parameters over a NACA 0012 profile in order to compare them with experimental results obtained in a transonic wind tunnel (PTT - Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel of Aerospace and Aeronautical Institute). The tunnel PTT is now in a campaign to test the sounding vehicle VS-30 and, many attempts are made to calibrate the tunnel; among them a NACA 0012 profile is used to verify the tunnel accuracy and to predict wall correction parameters. A bi-dimensional profile is installed in the test section of the tunnel, and its ends are adequately attached to the lateral walls to allow angle of attack setting. Over the profile surface many pressure holes are located along the chord, close to the central section, to obtain pressure distribution. The present work describes the main characteristics of the developed code applied to bi-dimensional geometries and the results obtained with the NACA 0012 for Mach number range from 0.2 to 0.8 at various angles of attack. The code was originally based on the Beam and Warming centered finite-difference, alternating-direction-implicit algorithm, applied to a bi-dimensional, body-conforming system of coordinates, with the time marching using first-order Euler approximation. The code was later modified to use the diagonal algorithm, firstly developed by Pulliam and Chaussee. Therefore, the final version is very fast for non transient problems. This is particularly important for the present research, when many flow cases must be investigated. A special C-type generated mesh was constructed with its external frontier distant about 30 chords from the profile leading edge. In order to better treat the near wall region, a node location stretching of 12% was employed. This node clustering close to the walls causes a level of refinement too restrictive downstream of the profile, at the wake region, creating a stiffness problem, and pre

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: First Throat Design of a Transonic Wind Tunnel

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao Pblica, Defesa e Seguridade Social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (PTT) from Aerospace and Aeronautical Institute is a conventional closed-loop wind tunnel, continuously driven by a main compressor at a Mach number range from 0.2 to 1.3, and it has automatic controls of stagnation pressure from 0.5 bar to 1.2 bar and temperature. The test section with 30 cm x 25 cm is equipped with slotted walls and mass removal is accomplished with re-entry flaps at the end of the test section and with a plenum evacuation system. Subsonic and near sonic Mach number condition is accomplished by main compressor rotation with sonic first throat. However, supersonic condition is only obtained with the use of supersonic first throat - a convergent-divergent nozzle. In many industrial installations the first throat geometry is remotely and automatically adjusted to a certain speed condition. In PTT this is done manually by changing the lateral walls of the first throat. Now the tunnel is equipped with two sets of first throat: one sonic throat (only convergent nozzle) and one supersonic throat (designed for Mach number 1.3). It is very important to develop other sets of first throat in order to more precisely establish various supersonic flow conditions into the test section. This work describes the steps followed during the conception design of new geometries for the first throat of PTT. The mathematical basis used is the method of characteristics to determine a non viscous solution for the wall geometry, following the method proposed by Foelsch to allow compression and expansion waves cancellation. Firstly, a numerical code was used to design the particular first throat geometry according to these ideas. The code also estimates the boundary-layer height along the nozzle. Secondly, a numerical code developed to calculate the Euler Equations was used to verify the nozzle behavior at some operational conditions. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In wind tunnels, aerospace vehicle models are tested in order to analyze their performance in real flight situations. The forces and moments exerted by the airflow on the surface of the test article are measured using multi-component balances. The balance measures the aerodynamic loads by using strain-gages. It is calibrated prior to the tests, resulting in the estimation of the parameters of the polynomial mathematical modelling relating the strain-gage readings to the aerodynamic loads. This paper presents the aerodynamic load values acting on a sounding rocket vehicle under test in a transonic aerodynamic facility. The force and moment coefficients and corresponding uncertainties are also estimated. The vehicle was tested in low Mach number conditions, with the airflow being supplied by the injection system. The second stage of the model was fitted with three different fin deflections. The measured quantities are total pressure, static pressure and total temperature of the flow, as well as the strain gage readings supplied by an internal balance. An analysis of the contribution for the uncertainties in the aerodynamic loads revealed that the measurement precision is the dominant component. The intermediate measurement precision of the tests was also considered.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of CFD codes has had a progressive participation in aeronautical research. In particular its application to analyze confined flows like those present in wind tunnels has supported physical phenomena investigations. With this motivation, it is being developed in the Aerodynamic Division (ALA) of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) a numerical code in order to simulate the flow over models installed in the test section of the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (PTT) of IAE. In a first attempt, the code will be used to simulate a NACA 0012 profile to help understanding the physical phenomena involved during the experimental tests proposed in PTT in the transonic regime (from Mach number 0.60 to 1.00), and to suggest corrections for the compressibility and wall effects for the experimental data obtained. This work describes the progress in the code development with the inclusion of laminar terms. The new code version is subjected to verification and validation procedures to guarantee its reliability. Five different physical situations were selected from different classes of laminar problems: incompressible free boundary layer, compressible free boundary layer, interference of shock wave on boundary layer, incompressible flow between flat plates and flow in a supersonic convergent-divergent nozzle. These cases represent classical problems for which a lot of results can be found.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Model of aerospace vehicles are tested in wind tunnels in order to predict their perfomance in real flight situations. Data originating from wind tunnel tests are used for the optimization of aerodynamic projects. The purpose of this study is to analyse the aerodynamic load coefficients of the Brazilian sounding rocket Sonda III, developed by the Institute of Aeronautics and Space. A campaign is in progress to test several configurations of the vehicle in the subsonic and transonic regime of airflow. The aerodynamic facility used to carry out the tests is the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel, located at the Aerodynamic Division of the Institute. The results presented in this paper include the drag force, side force and lift force coefficients and the pitching, rolling and yawing moment coefficients. The test article considered is the bi-stage model, composed of the first and the second stage of the vehicle. An internal multicomponent balance is employed to supply the force and moment readings. It measures the loads by using strain gauges arranged in Wheatstone bridges. The internal balance is fitted into the model being tested. Besides the aerodynamic components, the measured parameters include total pressure and static pressure of the airflow. The static pressure sensor is positioned at the inlet of the wind tunnel test section and the total pressure sensor is located at the stilling chamber of the circuit. The instrumentation is calibrated prior to the tests and the uncertainties in the quantities involved are estimated according to international standardization. Data reduction supplies load coefficient curves for&#10;angles of attack ranging from -10 o to +10 o for Mach number regimes varying from 0.3 to 1.0. Source of errors presented in the measurements are also analysed and quantified, and the procedures adopted to minimize them are reported in this paper. Their contribution to the final uncertainty is considered by applying the law of propagation of uncertainty to th

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present paper, preliminary results of global pressure measurements on a NACA 0012 profile, obtained with pressure sensitive paint (PSP) will be presented. The lifetime method was used. The measurements were conducted in the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (PTT) of Institute of Aeronautic and Space (IAE) for Mach number ranging from 0.2 to 0.7 and angle of attack of 4 degrees. For comparison with PSP results the model has been instrumented with pressure taps. Good agreement between the results obtained with both methods has been observed. However, in this initial test the influence of durst in the wind tunnel was noticed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Supersonic Injector Design for Using in a Mixing Chamber

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 13rd Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (PTT), located in the Aerodynamic Division (ALA) of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE), is a modern installation with a conventional closed aerodynamic circuit, continuously driven by a main compressor and with an intermittent injection system which operates in a combined mode to extend the tunnels operational envelope. The tunnel has automatic pressure controls (from 0.5 bar to 1.25 bar), Mach number (from 0.2 to 1.3), temperature and humidity, related to its test section (0.30 m wide and 0.25 m height). TTP is an 1/8th scale down from the industrial transonic project, and it was initially designed to study the innovative features of the industrial facility, specifically concerned with the injection system operation in combination with the conventional main compressor operation, but it was also designed for training the technical team in high speed&#10;phenomena, to perform basic research and academic research assessment, to produce tests in the development of new vehicles, and others. To explore the capabilities of its injection system, a parametric experimental study was idealized for its supersonic mixing chamber. However, since TTP is already in operation, modifications in the aerodynamic circuit components would interfere with the test campaigns. So, it was recently built a supersonic injection mixing chamber separated from the tunnels circuit, but still utilizing its compressed air system to drive one supersonic injector in it. Some of the assessed parameters related with the mixing chamber design are chamber lenght, area ratio, diffuser length and angle, injector Mach number etc. The mixing chamber section is 0.17 m wide and 0.23 m height and it has one supersonic injector with the same geometry of the TTP injection system, with the possibility of changing its angle, and one flat diffuser with approximately the same equivalent performance of the TTPs conical diffuser. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Diffuser Design for a Supersonic/Subsonic Mixing Chamber

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (PTT) is a modern installation, that can operate continuously by means of a main compressor, but also intermittenly with the assistance of an injection system which operates in a combined way with the main compressor. So the tunnel operation is a very complex issue, and many parameters must be set to obtain a perfect match. To get acquaintance with the tunnel operation and propose possible improvement modifications, a supersonic/subsonic mixing chamber was built with very similar design comparing with the one that already exists in the PTTs aerodynamic circuit. This work presents the main steps of the mixing chamber diffusers design. For simplicity, it was chosen a flat walls diffuser, which allows divergence angle variation, although the diffuser in TTP circuit is conical. Reasoning for this choice is presented along with the main flow phenomena that take place during a diffuser operation. The four primary flow regimes that can occur during operation are discussed as they have a direct impact in the performance of stalled and unstalled diffusers. The final design parameters are confronted with other wind tunnel diffuser designs in a special graphic that registers the geometric configuration of well-designed diffusers according to specialized literature. The work also presents a CFD analysis of the design with a typical operational configuration. For which it was utilized a numerical code to solve the Navier-Stokes two-dimensional equations using RANS method and with the turbulent effects being accounted for through the use of the Spalart and Allmaras oneequation scheme. The main interesting flow parameters (Mach number and turbulent level) were analyzed for vertical longitudinal plane that passes through the diffuser center line.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Atualmente est sendo realizada uma campanha de ensaios aeronuticos com o veculo de sondagem Sonda III no Tnel Transnico Piloto (TTP) do Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao (IAE) para investigao dos parmetros aerodinmicos do veculo. bastante comum, e de grande importncia, o uso de clculos tericos em apoio na compreenso dos resultados experimentais. Atravs de anlises comparativas podem ser determinadas as regies sobre o modelo que apresentem maiores gradientes de propriedades, identificando a existncia de ondas de choque/expanso etc. A previso do campo de escoamento de grande importncia, inicialmente, para a determinao das regies nas quais sero concentradas as tomadas de presso no modelo, e depois, para se estimar os principais parmetros de controle do tnel, desde a especificao inicial dos ensaios, como tambm durante os ajustes na operao do tnel empregados visando a um melhor gerenciamento da sequncia de ensaios. Assim, foi empregado um cdigo numrico para a resoluo das Equaes de Euler, desenvolvido em diferenas finitas centradas, num algoritmo implcito ADI (Alternating Direction Implicit), aplicado a um sistema de coordenadas&#10;curvilneas generalizadas bidimensional, com marcha no tempo usando aproximao de Euler de primeira ordem. O cdigo baseia-se no algoritmo diagonal proposto por Pulliam e Chaussee fazendo uso de viscosidade artificial espectral que lhe garante boa capacidade na captura das ondas de choque. O trabalho descreve as principais caractersticas do cdigo empregado (discretizao, malha computacional, condies iniciais e de contorno) e os principais testes empregados para os procedimentos de verificao e de validao. Finalmente, so apresentados os resultados obtidos para o modelo do Sonda III, na faixa de velocidade de nmero de Mach 0,8 a 1,4, com ngulos de ataque variando de 0 a 10 graus. A anlise dos resultados aponta para as principais regies de interesse, em termos&#10;de gradiente de presso e
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: An aeronautical campaign is now being executed with the sounding vehicle Sonda III in the Pilot Transonic Tunnel (TTP) from the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE), in order to investigate its aerodynamic characteristics. It is very common and very important to use the theoretical calculations as a helpful tool to understand the experimental results through comparisons which allow to determine regions of high properties gradients over the model, existence of shock/expansion waves, etc. To figure out the flow field it is very useful firstly to determine the regions where to locate pressure taps over the model and later to estimate the main parameters of the tunnel control. These tasks are related to the initial tests specification and also during the campaign, to obtain a better management during the tests. In this aim, it was used a numerical code for resolution of the well knwon Euler Equations. The code was developed in finite central differences, in an ADI (Alternating Direction Implicit) algorithm, applied to a twodimensional generalized curvilinear system of coordinates, with time march using first order Euler scheme. It was based in the diagonal algorithm proposed by Pulliam and Chaussee, and uses spectral artificial viscosity, that&#10;guarantees good characteristics to capture shock waves. This work describes the main code characteristics, computational mesh utilized, initial and boundary conditions, and main tests applied to the code as verification and validations procedures. Finally, it is presented the main results for the model Sonda III, in the Mach number range from 0.8 to 1.4, with attack angles varying from 0 to 10 degrees. An analysis of the results indicates the main regions, in terms of pressure gradient and shock/expansion waves, to guide a future location of pressure taps over the model to be tested in tunnel.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O TTP (Tnel Transnico Piloto) do IAE (Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao) um tnel convencional em circuito fechado, acionado por compressor principal na faixa de nmero de Mach de 0,2 a 1,3, com seo de testes com dimenses 0,30 m x 0,25 m. Uma constante preocupao com a questo energtica, quer pela escassez dos recursos naturais do planeta ou pela desejvel reduo de custos, tem levado ao uso de solues inovadoras. Nesse sentido, o TTP tambm pode operar intermitentemente com o uso de sistema de injeo de ar comprimido a alta presso, estendendo o envelope de operao do tnel, com a mesma potncia eltrica instalada. O sistema de injeo descarrega ar comprimido atravs de bicos injetores que operam entupidos com nmero de Mach de 1,9 promovendo&#10;a acelerao do escoamento primrio na cmara de mistura. de fundamental importncia o ajuste dos parmetros do sistema de injeo durante a operao combinada com o circuito principal do tnel, visando reduo de perdas na cmara de mistura. Um estudo paramtrico experimental da cmara de mistura extremamente desejado, embora de difcil execuo no circuito do tnel. Por isso, foi desenvolvido o projeto e a construo de uma cmara de mistura para avaliao paramtrica experimental, visando a otimizao do processo de mistura minimizao das perdas de carga. O trabalho apresenta as bases tericas empregadas na elaborao do projeto desta cmara de mistura, uma anlise das equaes da Mecnica dos Fluidos aplicadas a um volume de controle que modela esta cmara, como tambm a descrio de suas principais caractersticas. Finalmente, so apresentados os sistemas de medio para obteno dos principais parmetros da cmara de mistura juntamente com uma anlise dos primeiros resultados experimentais obtidos.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The PTT (Pilot Transonic Tunnel) of IAE (Institute of Aeronautics and Space) is a conventional closed-loop tunnel, powered by a main compressor within a Mach number range of 0.2 to 1.3, with test section dimensions of 0.30 m x 0.25 m. A frequent concern about the energetic issue, even for the leakage of the planet natural resources or for the desired cost reduction, has led to the use of innovative solutions. In this context, the PTT is also able of intermittent operation with the utilization of the compressed air injection system, extending the tunnel operation envelope with the same installed power. The injection system discharges compressed air through injector nozzles, which operates choked with Mach number of 1.9, in a mixing chamber promoting the primary flow acceleration. It is of fundamental importance to adjust the injection system parameters during the combined operation with the tunnel main circuit, in order to reduce the mixing chamber losses. A parametric experimental study on the mixing chamber is highly desired, although it is of difficult execution in the tunnel circuit. To this purpose, it was developed the project and construction of a mixing chamber for an experimental parametrical evaluation, in order to allow the mixing process optimization (load loss minimization). This work presents the theoretical principles that support a mixing chamber project, a Fluid Mechanics equations analysis applied to a control volume model and a brief description of its main characteristics. Finally, the measurement systems for the mixing chamber main parameters acquisition are&#10;described simultaneously to a first experimental results analysis presentation.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Scale models of aerospace vehicles are tested in wind tunnels in order to predict the performance of their full-scale counterparts during actual flight. A test campaign of the sounding rocket vehicle Sonda III is being carried out at the Brazilian Pilot Transonic Facility of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space. The Sonda III is a two stage research rocket designed to carry a payload capable of supplying technical data of experiments conducted under microgravity conditions. A model of the second stage of the vehicle was tested for several angles of attack, at Mach numbers in the transonic range. The purpose of the first part of the campaign is to estimate the aerodynamic loads that act on the test article. This paper describes the model and airflow configurations of the experiment and presents the results of these tests. The aerodynamic loads consist of three forces referred to as drag, side, and lift, and three moments denominated as rolling, pitching, and yawing. The loads are measured by a six-component aerodynamic internal balance whose sensor elements are strain gages arranged in Wheatstone bridges. The strain gage readings and the aerodynamic loads are related to a so-called calibration matrix composed of parameters evaluated during the balance calibration. Besides the aerodynamic loads, the measured parameters during the tests are total pressure, static pressure and total temperature. The data reduction consists of obtaining the variation of aerodynamic coefficients with angle of attack for the range of Mach number covered in the tests. Curves of load coefficients versus angle of attack are shown. Variation of the drag, lift and pitching coefficients with the Mach number and the behavior of lift force and pitching moment coefficient gradient with the Mach number for angle of attack equal to zero are compared with specialized bibliography. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O Tnel Transnico Piloto (TTP) do Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao (IAE) um tnel em uma escala reduzida de 1:8 de um tnel industrial, procurando manterem-se as mesmas solues tcnicas do tnel grande. No projeto de concepo elaborado pela empresa americana Sverdrup Technology Inc. em conjunto com equipe do IAE em 1988 foram levantados dados sobre as perdas em torno do circuito, baseado em clculos tericos e relaes empricas documentadas em literatura especializada. Nos dias atuais vrios tipos de ensaios so realizados no sentido de determinar as propriedades operativas da instalao visando a comparao com as previses tericas para uma completa compreenso dos fenmenos fsicos envolvidos em sua operao e possibilitar eventuais modificaes para aumento da eficincia e consequente ganho energtico. Uma caracterstica fundamental a ser conhecida num tnel de vento a perda de carga ao longo de seu circuito aerodinmico, que est relacionada com a potncia mecnica a ser fornecida pelo compressor principal, ou ainda com a taxa de compresso necessria. O trabalho apresenta os procedimentos empregados na determinao da perda de carga em vrios trechos do circuito, que foram instrumentado por tubos de Pitot conectados a sensores de presso. Aps um mapeamento inicial para levantar os resultados experimentais de seu circuito aerodinmico, comparando-os com os resultados tericos j conhecidos e identificando as discrepncias do projeto, pode-se notar que as maiores dificuldades encontradas foram na posio de sada do compressor principal e no difusor de alta velocidade, que se localiza aps a seo de injeo. A partir dos resultados foi investigada com maior detalhe a condio de operao do difusor com determinao do rendimento termodinmico do mesmo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (TTP) of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) is a wind tunnel on a reduced scale of 1:8 of an industrial tunnel, seeking to maintain the same technical solutions of the large tunnel. In the project design developed by the U.S. company Sverdrup Technology Inc. together with IAE team in 1988 data were collected on the losses around the circuit, based on theoretical calculations and empirical assumptions. Currently, several types of tests are being carried out to determine the facility operational characteristics in order to compare them with the predictions for a complete technical understanding of the physical phenomena involved in its operation and any possible modifications to increase efficiency and consequent energy gain. A fundamental feature to be known in a wind tunnel is the pressure loss along its aerodynamic circuit, that is related to the mechanical power to be supplied by the main compressor. The paper presents the procedures used in determining the pressure loss along the aerodynamic circuit, which were instrumented by Pitot probes connected to pressure sensors. After an initial mapping to raise the experimental results it was noted that the greater difficulties were at the main compressor outlet and at the high speed diffuser, which is located after the injection section. The diffuser operation was investigated to determine its thermodynamic efficiency.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Avaliao de Arrasto Utilizando os Cdigos Computacionais Missile DATCOM e MISL3
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: DRAG ASSESSMENT USING COMPUTATIONAL CODES MISSILE DATCOM E MISL3

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O trabalho tem como objetivo determinar curvas experimentais de arrasto atravs de ensaios aerodinmicos de modelo cone-cilindro no Tnel Transnico Piloto (TTP) instalado no Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao (IAE), com o objetivo de validar os resultados de simulaes obtidas atravs dos cdigos computacionais Missile DATCOM e MISL3 nos regimes de velocidade subsnica e transnica. dada nfase para a regio&#10;transnica tendo em vista a grande dificuldade em se obter resultados confiveis a partir de cdigos computacionais de engenharia para este regime de velocidades. Ressalta-se que estes cdigos computacionais so de grande uso na definio preliminar de configuraes geomtricas de veculos aeroespaciais e de defesa desenvolvidos no IAE. Este trabalho determina as curvas de arrasto em funo do nmero de Mach para um modelo-padro do tipo cone-cilindro de 20o de abertura e 0,78% de razo de bloqueio em relao rea transversal da seo de testes do TTP, com largura de 0,30 m e largura de 0,25 m, a ngulo de ataque zero.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work aims to determine experimental drag curves by aerodynamic tests undertaken in the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (TTP) from the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) using a cone-cylinder model. The reason for that is to validate the results from simulations obtained with computational codes Missile DATCOM and MISL3 at the subsonic and transonic speed ranges. Special attention is given to the transonic range in which it is expected great difficulty in determining the reliable results from the computational simulations. It is noteworthy that the computational codes used are very useful during preliminary definition of the geometric configurations of the aerospace and defense vehicles being developed in IAE. This work determines drag curves versus Mach number for a cone-cylinder standard model with 20o of cone at angle of attack zero and with 0.78% of blockage area, related to the TTPs test section cross sectional area, with 0.30 m wide and 0.25 m height.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Atualmente o Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao possui um tnel de vento transnico que faz parte do complexo de tneis de vento da ALA - Diviso de Aerodinmica do IAE Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao em So Jos dos Campos. Denominado como Tnel Transonico Piloto, tem seu projeto desenvolvido em escala 1/8 de um tnel de vento transnico industrial. Com um compressor principal axial de dois estgios com potncia de 830 kW, este tnel de vento capaz de fornecer de forma contnua escoamentos com velocidades transnicas de nmero de Mach at 1,3. A princpio foi concebido para avaliar as inovaes tecnolgicas que seriam adotadas no tnel industrial, treinar a equipe tcnica na realizao de ensaios transnicos e realizar pesquisa bsica, uma vez que seriam inditos estudos deste tipo dentro do territrio nacional. Por se tratar de um tnel de vento relativamente novo, uma forma de verificar sua confiabilidade a realizao de alguns experimentos com modelos conhecidos para que os resultados sejam comparados com os de outros tneis de vento. Um deles o aeroflio NACA 0012. O presente trabalho descreve os ensaios realizados com o aeroflio NACA 0012 na faixa de velocidade de nmero de Mach de 0,6 a 0,8. Para a investigao a ser realizada, recentemente o TTP adquiriu um conjunto para aplicao de tintas sensvel presso, programas computacionais e equipamentos eletrnicos que sero empregados nos experimentos com a tcnica PSP (Pressure Sensitive Paint). Desta forma, foram obtidos resultados em termos de distribuio de presso esttica sobre toda a superfcie do modelo, alm de ter sido possvel observar formaes de ondas de choque. PSP uma tcnica moderna, com excelentes resultados em situaes com grandes gradientes de presso, e que tem sido amplamente divulgada e empregada na maioria dos tneis de vento de alta velocidade. Finalmente, os resultados obtidos so comparados com resultados obtidos em outros tneis de vento.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nowadays the Institute of Aeronautics and Space has a transonic wind tunnel that makes part of the wind tunnels facility at ALA Aerodynamic Division of IAE Institute of Aeronautics and Space in So Jos dos Campos. Its named by Tnel Transnico Piloto, it have been designed in 1/8 scale of industrial transonic wind tunnel. With a main axial two-stage compressor of 830 kW, this wind tunnel is able to supply a continuously flow with transonic speeds of Mach number up to 1.3. Initially it was created to assess the technologic innovations that would be adopted on the industrial wind tunnel, training the technique team to realize the transonic experiments and to realize basic researches, because it would be the first studies into the national territory. How this wind tunnel is relatively new, one procedure to check the confidence is to realize some experiments with well known models to compare the results with other wind tunnels. One of the well known models is the NACA 0012 airfoil. The present paper describes the experiments with NACA 0012 airfoil in the Mach number range from 0.6 to 0.8. To accomplish this work, recently the TTP acquired a pressure sensitive paint kit, computational programs and electronic equipments that will be used on the PSP technique experiments (Pressure Sensitive Paint). In this way, it was obtained results in terms of static pressure distribution over the whole surface, beyond to observe the formation of wave shocks. PSP is a modern technique, with excellent results in high gradient pressure situations, and it has been divulgated and used in the most high speed wind tunnel. Finally, the results obtained are compared to other wind tunnel.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: DESCRIO DO PROJETO DO CTS DO TTP CAPTIVE TRAJECTORY SYSTEM DO TNEL TRANSNICO PILOTO
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: DESCRIPTION OF THE TTPS CTS PROJECT PILOT TRANSONIC WIND TUNNELS CAPTIVE TRAJECTORY SYSTEM

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VII Congresso Nacional de Engenharia Mecnica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O TTP (Tnel Transnico Piloto do IAE Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao) um tnel moderno capaz de ensaios aerodinmicos com nmero de Mach de 0,2 a 1,3 com controles automticos de presso (de 0,5 bar a 1,2 bar), temperatura e umidade. As paredes da seo de testes so semi-abertas para permitir a extrao de massa pelas fendas, evitando o fenmeno do entupimento aerodinmico, diminuindo os efeitos de parede e minimizando reflexes de ondas de expanso e compresso. A seo de testes envolvida em uma cmara plena, onde a presso controlada atravs de um compressor dedicado. Esta presso, juntamente com o ngulo de abertura dos flapes localizados no final da seo de testes, definem a vazo mssica pelas fendas. Em tneis de alta velocidade os modelos com corpo simples so conectados por meio de um dispositivo denominado sting que suportam o modelo por sua parte traseira, com o intuito de diminuir ao mximo os efeitos de interferncia com os dispositivos de fixao. Entretanto, h modelos complexos compostos por mais de um corpo, como o caso de veculos aeroespaciais com boosters acoplados a um corpo central ou artefatos suspensos nas asas de aeronaves, que no podem ser fixados na seo de testes sem um dispositivo auxiliar de posicionamento. Um sistema posicionador de trs graus de liberdade denominado CTS (Captive Trajectory System) foi projetado com o intuito de simular um projtil genrico sendo alijado de uma fuselagem, expandindo a capacidade de ensaios a serem desenvolvidos no TTP. Este posicionador controla a posio em X e Y do projtil e seu ngulo de ataque atravs do deslocamento linear de trs movimentadores independentes, controlados por motores de passos. Este trabalho apresenta as principais caractersticas do projeto do sistema de posicionamento CTS idealizado para o TTP.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The TTP (Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel of IAE Institute of Aeronautics and Space) is a modern tunnel capable of aerodynamic tests in Mach number range from 0.2 to 1.3 with automatic controls of pressure (from 0.5 bar to 1.2 bar), temperature and humidity. A stable and uniform flow in the test section is necessary to achieve a high quality of testing. In a transonic wind tunnel design the test section walls are semi-open to allow mass flow extraction, which is important to prevent aerodynamic chocking phenomenon, minimize shock/expansion wave reflections from walls, and also to help on wall correction effects. To set the mass flow ratio through the walls, the test section is enveloped by a plenum chamber, in which the pressure is controlled by means of a dedicated compressor. What determines how much of the flow will pass through the walls are mainly the plenum chamber pressure and the reentry flaps positioning, located at the end of the test section. On high-speed tunnels, models with simple body are connected through a device called &quot;sting&quot; that supports the model on its back, with the aim of reducing the interference effects with the fixation devices. However, there are more complex models composed of more than one body, such as aerospace vehicles with &quot;boosters&quot; coupled to a central body or artifacts suspended in aircraft wings, which can not be fixed in the test section without an auxiliary sting. A positioner system with three degrees of freedom called CTS (&quot;Captive Trajectory System&quot;) was designed in order to simulate a generic projectile being ejected from a fuselage, expanding the capability of tests to be developed in the TTP. This positioner controls the X and Y position of the projectile and its angle of attack through the linear displacement of three independent movers controlled by steps motors . This paper presents the main design features of the CTS positioning system designed for the TTP.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ANLISE DE MINI TNEL SUBSNICO POR INDUO
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: ANALYSIS OF A SMALL SUBSONIC INDUCTION WIND TUNNEL

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VII Congresso Nacional de Engenharia Mecnica

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho tem como objetivo analisar o escoamento na seo de testes de um mini tnel e detalhar seu projeto e construo. O mini tnel de vento operado por induo, utilizando uma cmara de mistura, com um injetor a nmero de Mach 1,9, que acionado por parte dos sistemas do Tnel Transnico Piloto (TTP) da diviso de Aerodinmica (ALA) do Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao (IAE). O novo circuito desenvolvido servir para a realizao de ensaios com fins acadmicos e operar em regime subsnico, no qual se pretende atingir escoamentos com nmero de Mach em torno de 0,4. As dimenses da seo de testes foram definidas a partir da aplicao da equao da continuidade na cmara de mistura e de relaes experimentais entre o fluxo de ar no bico injetor e o fluxo na cmara de mistura, obtidas em ensaios anteriores. Para investigao dos parmetros do mini tnel (presso total e presso esttica) foram utilizados tubos de Pitot, fixados em uma mesa de coordenadas e ligados sensores de presso. O nmero de Mach em cada ponto foi avaliado pela relao isentrpica e os ensaios realizados com varredura na seo de testes mostraram descolamento das camadas limite. A partir desta observao, um coletor foi projetado, construdo e instalado na entrada da seo de testes de forma a garantir a uniformidade do escoamento. Os novos ensaios indicaram uma uniformidade muito maior no escoamento, embora no tenha sido observada alterao aprecivel do nmero de Mach, que atingiu o valor de 0,37. Os resultados obtidos durante o processo de desenvolvimento do mini tnel atestam-no como instalao apropriada a ensaios aeronuticos em modelos de pequeno porte.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work aims to analyze the flow in the test section and to detail the steps undertaken during its design and manufacture. The small wind tunnel is driven by induction at Mach number 1,9 and it is installed in the Aerodynamic Division (ALA) from the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE). The facility uses parts of the Pilot Transonic Tunnel systems (TTP). The new wind tunnel will be used to perform tests for academic purposes and will operate in subsonic regime, and it is expected a maximum Mach number of about 0.4. The dimensions of the test section were defined by applying the continuity equation to the mixing chamber and previous experimental relation between the mass flow in the injector and mass flow in the mixing chamber. To assess the small wind tunnel parameters (total pressure and static pressure) Pitot probes were used, mounted at a coordinate table and connected to pressure sensors. The Mach Number in each point was calculated by isentropic relation. The tests undertaken in the test section pointed a strong boundary layer detachment. Thus, a specially designed air intake was installed at the test section entrance to guarantee a better uniformity in the flow. The tests showed a better flow uniformity, although no noticeable variation of Mach number was observed, reaching the value of 0.37. The final results prove that the new installation is adequate to perform tests for academic purposes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EVALUATION OF MACH NUMBER DISTRIBUTION AT THE TEST SECTION OF THE TTP TRANSONIC WIND TUNNEL

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XX IMEKO World Congress Metrology for Green Growth

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Maria Lusa Collucci da Costa Reis

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The distribution of the Mach number at the test section of the Brazilian Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel is under evaluation for the subsonic, transonic and low supersonic ranges. The measured parameters in these investigative tests are static and total pressure of the airflow, which are the input quantities for the isentropic equation used for the Mach number estimation, which is the output quantity. The measurement of static pressures at several stations of the test section is accomplished by positioning a pressure probe at the centreline and by distributing pressure taps along the superior and inferior walls. The total pressure is measured at two locations: at the stilling chamber of the circuit and at the tip of the probe. Data reduction includes the evaluation of the uncertainties associated with the measured quantities, as well as their propagation to the output quantity, employing the Monte Carlo method. Least squares fitting is applied to the experimental data in order to supply Mach number distribution as a function of longitudinal positions of the test section. The distribution at the centreline resulting from the tests is compared to Computational Fluid Dynamics simulation for the supersonic regime.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: INTERNAL BALANCE DEVELOPMENT FOR DRAG MEASUREMENTS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of ENCIT 2012, 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The measurement of steady and fluctuating aerodynamic forces acting on a body is one of the main tasks in wind tunnel experiments. In aerodynamic testing, strain gauge balances will usually be applied as, particularly in the past, the main focus was directed to the measurement of steady forces. During the early years of wind tunnel testing, forces and moments were literally measured through pan-type balances, called internal balances. Nevertheless, technology has advanced since those early days, the term balance is still applied to different devices used for force and moment measurements. Internal balances are almost universally used for measurements in supersonic and transonic tunnels and are also becoming popular in subsonic tunnels, indeed they can be used in different wind tunnels, ranging from low-speed to transonic, from short to continuous running time and encompassing cryogenic and high pressure principles. The aim of this project is to manufacture a low cost internal balance, that will be useful in many experimental campaigns, specially in drag measurements, in the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) from DCTA. Thus, an internal balance was designed and will be properly produced, calibrated and tested, but it is very important that the balance displays high rigidity and low interference between the individual force components so that it is possible to obtain a satisfactory calibration.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EXPERIMENTS IN TRANSONIC WIND TUNNEL USING A SUPERSONIC FIRST-THROAT

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of ENCIT 2012, 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The purpose of this work is to describe the preliminar experimental data obtained with the supersonic firstthroat installed in the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (TTP) of the Aerodynamic Division of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space. It is presented the main components of the wind tunnel, as well as the acquisition systems used to assess the experimental data. A special designed pressure probe with 33 measuring stations was utilized to obtain the Mach number distribution at the test section center line. It was also used 25 pressure taps distributed along the top and bottom walls of the tunnel to obtain the Mach number distribution along the test section walls. The tunnel used injection system in a combined fashion with the continuous operation of the tunnel to reach Mach number 1.3. Mass flow extraction was also used with the re-entry flaps at 5 degrees open to enhance the Mach number uniformity along the test section. The experimental results in terms of the Mach number deviation were compared with other typical wind tunnel experimental data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EVALUATION OF THE EFFECTS OF ILLUMINATION, TEMPERATURE AND PAINTING FINISH IN PSP TECHNIQUE

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of ENCIT 2012, 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper reports the results of global pressure measurements on a NACA 0012 profile, obtained with the Pressure Sensitive Paint technique (PSP), and compares them with conventional pressure tap measurements with the purpose of analyzing the influence of parameter as illumination efficiency and temperature variation of the air flow in the accuracy of the PSP experimental results. The experimental measurements were conducted in the Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (TTP) of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) for Mach number values of 0.4, 0.6 and 0.8. The experiments showed that in a carefully prepared experiment, under appropriated operational conditions, and nice adjustments of the PSP components, the obtained results can be accurate. Moreover, even when the influence of temperature is significant and the illumination condition is not ideal, it was possible to estimate well the pressure distribution over the profile.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: PRESSURE DISTRIBUTIONS ON AN AGARD MODEL IN A TRANSONIC WIND TUNNEL USING PSP TECHNIQUE

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of ENCIT 2012, 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The TTP (Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel) of the IAE (Institute of Aeronautics and Space) is a modern installation and completely operational but, since it is a relatively new installation, new technologies and procedures are being aggregated and special tests are needed to verify its reliability in comparison with other wind tunnel installations. Among many testing devices used to assess the flow behavior in the test section of a transonic wind tunnel, standard models are very useful because they provide a more complete test assessment for the verification of final aerodynamic parameters. The AGARD association (Advisory Group for Aerospace Research and Development) has created useful standard models which are now widely used because of the great amount of compiled data in the scientific literature. The models are used as an inter-laboratorial tool to compare wind tunnel performances. Standard Model C was used in the tests undertaken in the TTP because it has good transonic behavior. In this approach, the pressure distribution over the model was found by the PSP (Pressure Sensitive Paint) technique that allowed determination of the surface pressure field in front region of the model to be compared with the experimental data from a reliable transonic industrial installations, the +AA 7 TWT wind tunnel. Thus, experimental data obtained in TTP with a standard AGARD Model C available in the Aerodynamic Division (ALA) was compared with data obtained from the literature showing a good agreement in the pressure coefficient distribution over the model, attesting the tunnel reliability in aeronautical experiments.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ANALYSIS OF A NACA 0012 PROFILE IN A SMALL SUBSONIC INDUCTION DRIVEN WIND TUNNEL

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of ENCIT 2012, 14th Brazilian Congress of Thermal Sciences and Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Aerodynamic Division (ALA) from the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) has recently developed a small wind tunnel driven by induction. Through a test campaign, it was verified the good quality of the flow in the test section, certifying it to perform reliable tests. The tunnel is driven by a mixing chamber which uses a supersonic injector working at Mach number 1.9. As the stagnation pressure varies in the injector up to 10 bar, the flow in the test section is established up to Mach number 0.37. The test section is square with side length of 0.144 m. In these kinds of installations, it is very common to use standard devices to investigate the quality of the flow in the test section, such as Pitot probes, pressure probes, yaw-meters, etc. In addition, standard models with simple geometries are frequently used in order to compare the experimental results with theoretical predictions and even with experimental results from other wind tunnels. Tests like these characterize a specific phase nominated calibration phase, in which the main operational characteristics of the installation are assessed. With this aim, an aeronautical profile NACA 0012 was installed in the small wind tunnel, since there are extensive available data in the scientific literature. Pressure taps over the profile surface were done and they were connected to pressure sensors to determine the pressure distribution over the model. Two models with 10,4% and 7% of blockage ratio were installed in the test section, and the installation allows angle of attack adjustments. Near the test section entrance, a pressure tap at the tunnel wall was used to determine the undisturbed Mach number condition. This report describes the main steps undertaken during the test campaign with the NACA 0012 models in the small wind tunnel in the range from Mach number 0.15 to 0.37 and angles of attack -5, 0 and +5, with concern about the blockage effects.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Numerical and Experimental Study of an Airfoil in a Transonic Wind Tunnel

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 51st AIAA Aerospace Sciences Meeting

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Transonic wind tunnels are sophisticated tools for the investigation of flows with Mach numbers of order one. The most characteristic feature of a facility such as this is, for sure, the openings in the walls of the test section. The openings in the walls permit the proper relief effect, and this, on the other hand, makes possible the experimentation at the transonic range. The results to be presented in this paper represent the start of a program to develop a kind of check list of the many aspects of the PTT, the Brazilian pilot transonic wind tunnel. To this end we have installed a NACA 0012 profile in the tunnel. The pressure distributions were investigated for Mach numbers in the range 0.6 - 0.8 and angles of attack from 0&#8304; up to 8&#8304;. Besides, the flow about the airfoil inside the tunnel was simulated numerically considering the walls with and without slots. The experimental and numerical results are finally compared and checked also against literature data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Surface Pressure Measurements on a Space Lauch Vehicle in the Transonic Regime

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 22nd International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Wind tunnel surface pressure measurements are important for understanding the aerodynamics of flight vehicles, as well as to identify specific phenomena, such as shock waves occurrences. The most commonly used method for pressure measurements is through pressure taps, in which small orifices are installed in several positions on the model surface, and these small holes are connected by flexible tubes to pressure transducers. Despite its many advantages, this method is costly and demands high installation time. In addition, the pressure taps can not be installed in some areas of the models due to physical limitations. Alternatively, there is the relatively new technique of Pressure Sensitive Paint (PSP), which is based on the deactivation of the luminescence due to the presence of oxygen. This method has high spatial resolution and is a non-intrusive measurement. In the present study, results obtained from pressure measurements performed in a transonic wind tunnel with a sounding model using PSP and pressure taps will be presented and discussed. Flow features around the model obtained using the Schlieren technique will also be discussed. The measurements were performed for values of Mach number between 0.5 and 1.1 for zero angle of attack. A good agreement between the results obtained with PSP and pressure taps were obtained. Complex flow phenomena as shock and expansion waves as well as flow separation regions were clearly identified.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: STUDY OF WELDING FSW (FRICTION STIR WELDING) OF ALUMINUM ALLOY 2024-T3 AND ELECTROLYTIC COPPER

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 22nd International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents results from an experimental study of the process of Friction Stir Welding (FSW) in non-ferrous metals such as Aluminum and Copper, and its alloys. The FSW technique can utilize a milling machine and a cylindrical tool with a specific pin for this purpose. This tool rotates at a certain speed and pressure in order to heat the metal, softening them in the region of the joint of two sheets, and thereby perform continuous welding in the solid state. To study the FSW technique, some specimens were produced and subjected to tensile test. Preliminary experimental results showed that, compared with literature results, they could still be improved. So, tests were again undertaken with the following remarks: (i) the use of FSW AA2024-T3 alloy Aluminum and electrolytic Copper with 99.9751% of purity that once welded and inspected, can be detected the presence of defects, (ii ) the defects were found according to existing literature, (iii) the results were analyzed in the region of the welding. Thus, a broad idea of application of FSW technique is presented, highlighting that this technique already has numerous applications in the aerospace, aeronautical and naval industries. Furthermore, the technique presented herein has a cost-benefit very interesting and low environmental impact, which favors its use in the domestic industry.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: WALL CORRECTION FOR A NACA 0012 IN A SMALL SUBSONIC INDUCTION DRIVEN WIND TUNNEL WITH THE AID OF NUMERICAL CALCULATION

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 22nd International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A small induction driven wind tunnel with cross-sectional area 0.144 m x 0.144 m was built in the Aerodynamic Division (ALA) of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) to be used as a useful tool in subsonic aerodynamic academic tests. After many functional tests, a two-dimensional model of a NACA 0012 profile was installed to assess the reliability characteristics of the tunnel in performing tests of real interest, by means of pressure distribution over the profile. The focus is to study the influence of the wind tunnel solid walls, which are of great importance in case of subsonic test sections. Particularly, the problem represents a real challenge since the available model has 7% of blockage area ratio, which is relatively high for typical subsonic wind tunnel tests. In a first attempt theoretical and empirical approaches from the specialized literature were used to reasonably correct the pressure coefficient distribution. Now, numerical simulation is carried out to help with the wall corrections extrapolations. Euler equations approach were used to simulate the test section region installed with the NACA 0012 profile, and the boundary layer was accounted for by modifying the solid walls geometry to comply with the theoretical prediction.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EXPERIMENTAL RESULTS OF THE INTER-STAGE REGION OF SOUNDING ROCKET SONDA III IN A TRANSONIC WIND TUNNEL

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 22nd International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Maria Lusa Collucci da Costa Reis

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel (TTP) of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space (IAE) has been conducting a research project sponsored by the CNPq (National Counsel of Technological and Scientific Development Brazil) to investigate the interference between the fins and the fuselage of the Sounding Rocket Aerospace Vehicle Sonda III. The aim of the investigation is to become better acquainted with the existing interference on the rocket inter-stage region in the presence of fins. A half-model of the Sonda III in scale 1:8 was built and installed on the side wall of the tunnel test section. The model has 49, 70 and 35 pressure taps distributed on the first-, second- and inter-stage, respectively, to analyze the pressure distribution near the inter-stage region. Experiments in sequence with increasing configuration complexity are being conducted (with no fins, with one fin perpendicular to the test section wall and with two fins positioned at 22.5 degrees in relation to the tunnel wall) in order to investigate the influence of the fins at various flow conditions. The tests will include variations in Mach number from 0.2 to 1.1, stagnation pressure from 0.5 bar to 1.2 bar and model angles of attack of 0, 5.5 and 8 degrees. This work shows some significant preliminary results undertaken with Mach numbers from 0.2 to 1.1.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Analysis of Filtering Processes Influence on Pressure Distribution Results Obtained with PSP Technique

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 22nd International Congress of Mechanical Engineering

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Tests were performed at the TTP (Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel) of the IAE (Institute of Aeronautics and Space) in order to analyze the pressure field surface distribution over an AGARD standard model and help certifying the tunnel realiability. The results were obtained varying the Mach number from 0.4 up to 1.1 and the pressure distribution over the model was found by the PSP (Pressure Sensitive Paint) technique. It allowed the complete determination of the pressure over the surface of the model and the results could be compared with experimental data from reliable transonic industrial installations, namely, the AEDC 16' PWT and the NAA 7' TWT wind tunnels. The PSP is a relatively new optical technique that is being agregated to the TTP with the aim of improving the test capabilities and procedures. Therefore, as an optical instrumentation, filtering processes and its effects on the pressure distribution should be considered relevant. The present work will evaluate the effect of different filters (Gaussian, Median, Flat) and the variation of its parameters (number of iterations, filter diameter) applied at the pressure fields so as to obtain a less oscillatory, but still physically meaningful result. Afterwards, images of compressible effects, obtained with Schlieren technique, will be used in order to determine the capability of PSP technique to identify and proper localize structures as shocks and expansion waves. As the Schlieren technique does not involve any filtering process it is a suitable tool for comparison with the PSP results.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Aerospace Technology and Management (Online)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel of the Institute of Aeronautics and Space has conducted the fi rst test campaign of a sounding vehicle, Sonda III. The campaign is part of a project whose activities and fi nal results are presented in this paper. During the test campaign, many activities were performed to increase the productivity and accuracy of the tunnel. These activities included calibration procedures, corrective and preventive trials, development of auxiliary devices, and theoretical and experimental analysis. Two tasks are described in details: the development and tests performed with the static pressure probe and the automatic re-entry fl ap actuation system. Several tests were carried out with the Sonda III at Mach numbers ranging from 0.3 to 1.0, at stagnation pressures of 70, 94, and 110 kPa. Experimental results include global aerodynamic coeffi cients (using internal balance) and pressure distribution over essential regions of the test article (using pressure sensitive paint technique).

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel of Institute of Aeronautics and Space (PTT Pilot Transonic Wind Tunnel) is an important result of a tremendous effort to install a high speed wind tunnel complex (TTS acronyms for Transonic and Supersonic Tunnels, in Portuguese) at the IAE, to support Brazilian aerospace research. Its history is described below, starting from the moment the TTS project was first conceived, highlighting each successive phase, mentioning the main difficulties encountered, and the solutions chosen, up until the final installation of the Pilot facility. A brief description of the tunnel's shakedown and calibration phases is also given, together with the present campaigns and proposed activities for the near future.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: Estudo Numrico do Processo de Injeo em um Tnel de Vento Transnico
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO-INGLES: Numerical Study of the Injection Process in a Transonic Wind Tunnel

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao Pblica, Defesa e Seguridade Social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Resumo&#10;Injetores supersnicos so instalados em tneis de vento transnicos com a finalidade de estender o envelope operacional baseado no nmero de Reynolds, sem demandar maior potncia do compressor principal. O objetivo deste trabalho estudar numericamente o processo de injeo do Tnel Transnico Piloto do CTA. A cmara de injeo contm cinco bicos injetores localizados no piso e cinco no teto do tnel, os quais operam com nmero de Mach 1,9, fornecendo quantidade de movimento adicional corrente principal do circuito do tnel. Tal cmara na verdade a prpria seo de transio do tnel, a qual, por sua vez, localiza-se imediatamente antes do difusor. Devido grande diferena entre as dimenses dos injetores e da seo transversal do tnel, onde os mesmos encontram-se montados, o tratamento tem que ser necessariamente tridimensional. Para tanto foi desenvolvido um cdigo numrico baseado nas equaes de Navier-Stokes com mdia de Reynolds, seguindo-se o princpio do algoritmo diagonal em diferenas finitas, e efeitos de turbulncia foram previstos por meio do esquema de Spalart e Allmaras. Vrias hipteses simplificadoras foram introduzidas para tornar o problema factvel e a integrao numrica realizada dividindo o domnio de clculo em sub-regies. Mesmo assim, devido ao grande nmero de pontos, foi aplicada uma tcnica de malhas seqenciais para economizar o tempo computacional. O escoamento na regio de mistura foi simulado com sucesso e os resultados foram todos consistentes. Com os valores dos parmetros conhecidos em todo o domnio computacional, foram calculados o coeficiente de perda de carga, o ganho e a eficincia do processo de injeo parmetros estes de grande importncia na engenharia de tneis de vento. Entre diversos aspectos fsicos muito interessantes, destaca-se a formao de domos de choque e expanso ao longo da direo longitudinal no processo de mistura.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Abstract&#10;Supersonic injectors are installed in a transonic wind tunnel with the ultimate objective of expanding the Reynolds number envelope, without demanding extra power from the main compressor. The injectors are positioned at the entrance of the transition module, whose exit section constitutes the beginning of the first diffuser. This idea is being incorporated to the design of the Brazilian transonic wind tunnel (it is already installed in the pilot facility). The aim of this research effort is to calculate numerically, and, in the sequel, analyze, the mixing process involving the supersonic jets from the injectors and the tunnel subsonic main stream. Five nozzles are positioned at the floor and five at the ceiling of the tunnel, and due to the great difference between a typical dimension of the nozzles and the lateral width of the tunnel section, the study has, necessarily, to take into account the three-dimensionality of the resulting flow. A Reynolds-Averaged Navier-Stokes numerical code was developed following the main lines of the finite-difference diagonal algorithm, and turbulence effects are accounted for through the use of the Spalart and Allmaras one-equation scheme. Several simplifying assumptions are introduced in order to render the problem minimally tractable, and the numerical integration is accomplished by dividing the calculation domain in sections. Even then, and due to the great number of node points in each section, a sequence-of-grids technique was applied in order to gain in computational time. The flow field in the mixing region was successfully simulated, and the results are all consistent. After having the values of the parameters over the entire computational domain, the injection process loss factor, gain, and efficiency were duly calculated. These figures are of great importance to those who deal with the engineering of wind tunnels. Many very interesting physical aspects are encountered, and among them, it is worth noting the form
