INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: RESUMO&#10;Este trabalho descreve um modelo matemtico, baseado na tcnica de parmetros concentrados, para resolver as equaes bsicas da continuidade, da energia e da quantidade de movimento, e sua aplicao no circuito aerodinmico de um tnel de vento transnico, movido por um compressor principal e com eventual uso adicional de injeo, em regime transiente. As variveis do sistema de equaes so a densidade, a energia interna e o fluxo de massa. O modelo construdo de maneira que permite implementar os principais sistemas de controle da presso de estagnao, temperatura de estagnao e nmero de Mach relativos s condies na seo de testes e o sistema de injeo. Esses sistemas so discretizados a partir do mtodo de diferenas finitas para acoplamento com o modelo aplicado ao circuito aerodinmico do tnel. O modelo utilizado na investigao dos fenmenos transientes, como comportamento do tnel s solicitaes dos controles e sua estabilidade de operao. O modelo foi testado para o tnel AWT (&quot;Altitud Wind Tunnel&quot; da NASA, Lewis), com o objetivo de validao do modelo desenvolvido no presente trabalho. Finalmente, foi feita anlise do tnel transnico do CTA (TTCTA) com seus principais sistemas de controle implementados, inclusive o uso da injeo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT&#10;This work describes a lumped parameter mathematical model to be applied in an aerodynamic circuit of a transonic wind tunnel driven by a main compressor and a compressed air injection system. The model solves the basic equations of continuity, energy and momentum. The equation variables are density, internal energy and mass flow. The model is constructed so to allow implementation of main control actions through the control variables, related to test section conditions: Mach number, stagnation pressure and stagnation temperature. The systems are discretized based on the backward difference method that are processed alongside the aerodynamic circuit model. The model is used in transient phenomena investigation of the tunnel response to control actions, and its stability. The model was applied for the AWT (&quot;Altitud Wind Tunnel&quot; of NASA-Lewis) with the aim of validating the present work. Finally, the model was applied for the CTAs wind tunnel (TTCTA), with the main control systems modeled, including injection.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-SOFTWARE.TITULO-DO-SOFTWARE-INGLES: Numerical code in Fortran for Determination of a Transonic Wind Tunnel Behavior

DETALHAMENTO-DO-SOFTWARE.FINALIDADE: Avaliar a estabilidade do Tnel Transnico

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FALCO FILHO, J. B. P.;PFALCAOFILHO, J;Falco Filho, Joo Batista P.;FALCO FILHO, J.B.P.;FILHO, J. B. P. F.;FILHO, J B P FALCAO;FALC, JO;FALCAO, JO;FALCO FILHO, JOO BATISTA PESSOA;FILHO, JOO BATISTA PESSOA FALCO;FILHO, J B P FALCO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O cdigo numrico, desenvolvido em Fortran, foi utilizado para avaliao do comportamento transiente do Tnel Transnico do CTA (em Projeto), para avaliar o desempenho do tnel com o uso dos controles automticos de presso de estagnao, de temperatura de estagnao e do nmero de Mach relativos seo de testes e combinado com o uso da injeo de massa. O programa utiliza a tcnica de parmetros concentrados (anlise zero dimensional), objetivando uma rapidez no clculo e implementa o modelo dos diversos subsistemas de controle do tnel, bem como do circuito aerodinmico.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The numerical code, developed in Fortran, was used to evaluate the transient behavior of the Transonic Wind Tunnel of CTA (in design), in order to obtain the tunnel performance when the automatic controls of stagnation pressure, temperature and Mach number related to the test section are at work. The combined action of the injection system is also analysed. The code uses the lump parameters technique (zero dimensional analysis), with the aim of accelerating the calculations and the code also models the many control subsystems of the tunnel, and the aerodinamic circuit as well.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O cdigo numrico foi desenvolvido baseado nas equaes de Navier-Stokes com mdia de Reynolds, seguindo-se o princpio do algoritmo implcito ADI de Beam e Warming, adaptado ao mtodo de diagonalizao de Chaussee em diferenas finitas tridimensional, e os efeitos de turbulncia foram previstos por meio do esquema de Spalart e Allmaras.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The numerical code was based on the Reynolds-Averaged Navier-Stokes equations, following the main lines of the ADI implicit algorithm of Beam and Warming, adapted to the diagonalization method of Chaussee in 3D finite differences, and the turbulence effects were accouted for through the use of the Spalart and Allmaras one-equation scheme.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Curso bsico de escoamento compressvel, consistindo de 12 aulas abrangendo os temas:&#10;1 - Conceitos iniciais da Mecnica dos Fluidos I (equao da continuidade)&#10;2 - Conceitos iniciais da Mecnica dos Fluidos II (equao da quantidade de movimento)&#10;3 - Conceitos iniciais da Mecnica dos Fluidos III (equao da energia)&#10;4 - Conceitos iniciais da Mecnica dos Fluidos IV (equao de Bernouilli)&#10;5 - Escoamento compressvel - Velocidade do Som&#10;6 - Escoamento compressvel - Variao de rea&#10;7 - Uso da tabela isentrpica - Bocal DeLaval&#10;8 - Operao de bocais&#10;9 - Choque normal&#10;10 - Aplicaes do choque normal&#10;11 - Ondas de choque oblquas&#10;12 - Escoamento de Prandtl-Meyer.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A based course of compressible flow, consisting of 12 classes:&#10;1 - Basic concepts of Fluid Mechanics I (continuity equation)&#10;2 - Basic concepts of Fluid Mechanics II (momentum equation)&#10;3 - Basic concepts of Fluid Mechanics III (energy equation)&#10;4 - Basic concepts of Fluid Mechanics IV (equation of Bernouilli)&#10;5 - Escoamento compressvel - Velocidade do Som&#10;6 - Escoamento compressvel - Variao de rea&#10;7 - Compressible flow - DeLaval nozzle&#10;8 - Nozzle operation&#10;9 - Normal shock&#10;10 - Normal shock applications&#10;11 - Oblique shock waves&#10;12 - Prandtl-Meyer flow

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao Pblica, Defesa e Seguridade Social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: With the advent of powerful computer hardware, Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) has been vastly used by researchers and scientists to investigate flow behavior and its properties. The cost of CFD simulation is very small compared to the experimental arsenal as test facilities and wind-tunnels. In the last years may CFD commercial packages were developed and some of them possess prominence in industry and academia. However, some specific CFD calculations are particular cases and sometimes need special attention due to the complexity of the flow. In these cases, meticulous research becomes necessary. This is the case of turbomachinery flow calculations. The development of CFD codes applied to turbomachinery flow simulations and its implementation issues are not avaiable. A few institutions have this type of knowledge. Each CFD code has its particularities. Developing a CFD code is very interest subject in academia. In this work, a computational code, written in FORTRAN, was developed to calculate internal flows in turbomachines using CFD techniques. The solver is capable of calculating the three-dimensional flows not only for turbomachines. For instance, internal and external flows of nozzles and airfoils can be calculated. The approach used allows the use of unstructured meshes of hexahedral elements. Euler, Navier-Stokes and turbulent equations can be calculated depending on the user settings. Different numerical schemes were implemented for time and space integration. Numerical tools to improve the stability and to increase the time-step (local time-step and implicit residual soothing) were also implemented and all details are described in this work. The origin of this solver is to simulate flows in compressors and turbines. Therefore, both rotating and non-rotating frames of reference are calculated simultaneously. Hence, the verification and validation processes were run for both inertial and non-inertial systems. A step-by-step design procedure is presented in
